resources.string: BeHear uses sonification in order to convey real statistical data in real-time
For example, socio-econimic data on statistical areas in jerusalem (Taken from CBS) is sonified through voices of babies: the more the area has a lower socio-economic status, the more the babies cry.
Data on votes is taken from official governmental data and is sonified through speeches of leaders of the main party elected in this area.
You can choose to hear these together, or each on alone.
If you want to explore Jerusalem yourself, press on the "Explore" checkbox, create a marker and drag it through the map. you will hear the data you requested on the area your finger is pointing to.
